understanding.p: A documentation set (doc-set) is a collection of one or more related topic sets. The topic sets in the documentation set can use different schemas.

planning-question.planning-question-title: Do I need to define a documentation set?

planning-question-body.p: You need to define a documentation set to group related topic-sets into a single documention set.

how-to-answer-body.p: It is not necessary to create a collection of topic sets; you can put all your topics into a single topic set. However, if you use a documentation set with multiple topic sets, you can present your topic sets in a specific order in the table of contents in the output. A documentation set also enables you to reuse topic sets in different documentation sets.

doing.p: To add a documentation set, you define the doc-set in the SPFE configuration file used to build the documents. A documentation set must have at least one topic set. You cannot define a doc-set in a separate file and use an include element to incorporate it. You can only define one doc-set in the SPFE configuration file. If you include more than one definition, either in the SPFE configuration file or in an include file, the build system ignores the subsequent definitions. You need the following mandatory elements:

li.p: id: The name of the document set; it should be a valid directory name for the operating system, as it is used as a subdirectory name under the build directory
title: The title of the document set to display in the output
topic-set-type-order: The order in which the topic sets are shown in the table of contents of the documentation set

topic-sets: The list of the configuration files of the topic sets to include in the doc set; the value of the id attribute should normally match the topic-set-id in the topic set configuration file; the href attribute is the path and file name of the topic set configuration file
